comment: Fantastic person and a wonderful director. She came in clutch from the day I signed up to the day she left. Absolutely phenomenal.

Dr T is the most amazing, caring, and motivated woman you will ever meet. The amount of time and effort she pours into the marching band is just insane. She knows all 200 students in the band by name and makes an effort to make sure we're all being the best marchers, musicians, and people that we can be. 11/10

One of the most unprofessional professors I have encountered at KSU. She does not check email, so don't bother trying. She spoke negatively about our class to students at KSU who haven't graduated yet. She contradicts herself frequently. She can't handle constructive criticism. Unwilling to put effort in to solve necessary class issues. 0/5 stars

Dr.T is an amazing Marching Band director. The grade is based fully on attendance. Try not to miss practices and definitely don't miss a game. She is very available outside of practice, answering emails fairly quickly and in her office before and after practices. The KSUMB performs a pregame show and different halftime shows throughout the season.
Dr. T is the best teacher you will ever have. I had her for marching band and she makes it so much fun.
I had Dr. T for marching band and she's SUCH a helpful, fun, inspiring lady who helped us sound PHENOMENAL even with COVID regulations. 10/10 would take again!

This woman is so talented when it comes to conducting and pedagogy leadership. We had interesting discussions on how music education is perceived and conducting our own arrangements of concert music with our class was incredibly rewarding after the hours of putting them together. Dr. T is someone who will support and love you as her student always.

There are so many good things I could say about this woman. She genuinely loves each and every one of her students while being so professional and serving as an inspirational role model in her field. She will take time out of her busy schedule to talk if you need it. Her philosophy is to be fair and she embodies everything a professor should be.

350 characters isn't enough to do Dr. T. justice. She is not only one of the greatest music educators I've ever met, but one of the greatest educators I've ever met. Her dedication to her craft is unparalleled and the work she has put into the marching band has created the foundation to make the program at Kennesaw world class. She's the best!

I love and miss Dr. T. Coming from an OU student who had her a few years back I wish she was still here. Everything changed when she left and it wouldn't have been perfectly fine if she was hired over Dr. Stolarik.

Join marching band! Dr. T is a wonderful person that genuinely cares about everyone in the program. This class provides an excellent opportunity to KSU students and can be taken for 0 or 1 credit. You will need to audition in early August/spring for colorguard/drumline. Rehearsals are T/Th and some Fridays. The rewards outweigh the costs. Do it!
She's a great teacher who is funny, energetic, and engaging.

Dr. T is by far one of the most inspirational people I've ever had the honor of  meeting. She goes around every day trying her best to make everyone else smile. She has the biggest heart around and hardest working person on this campus.

Best professor at KSU! She cares about each and every student and has hilarious stories! She is fair and balanced and there is no worries when taking this class. She provides us with challenging literature but the way she teaches it makes you feel like it is easy! She is the best professor EVER! If you want to receive a 100, go to class!
I love Dr. T so much
Dr T. Is literally the best person on the face of the earth

Loved doing concert band with Dr. Traficante. She is a wonderful director and is very skilled at what she does. If you are not a music major and want to keep playing like me, PLEASE join concert band. It is a blast and you won't forget it!
